seniority_level.evidence: No specific years mentioned, but comprehensive skill requirements and end-to-end development responsibilities suggest mid-level rather than senior. The role involves significant responsibility but lacks explicit senior-level indicators like mentoring or architecture leadership.

job_family.evidence: Title is explicitly 'Data Engineer' and core responsibilities focus on data platform development, ELT pipelines, data warehousing, and data infrastructure - all core data engineering functions.

sub_specialty.evidence: Strong emphasis on data warehousing solutions, Kimball methodology, Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, and data modeling. Core focus is on structured data warehouse patterns rather than streaming or ML infrastructure.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role focuses on individual contributor work like developing pipelines, data modeling, and platform maintenance. No mention of team leadership, direct reports, or mentoring responsibilities.

primary_cloud.evidence: AWS explicitly mentioned multiple times including 'AWS cloud infrastructure' and 'AWS CDK'. While other clouds (Snowflake, BigQuery) are mentioned, AWS appears to be their primary infrastructure platform.

secondary_clouds.evidence: BigQuery (GCP) and Redshift (AWS) both mentioned as core platforms, suggesting multi-cloud approach. Snowflake could be considered separate from these major providers.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on ELT pipelines, automated data integration, and scheduled data processing. No real-time or streaming technologies mentioned, suggesting traditional batch processing approach.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Jenkins mentioned for CI automation, but given the cloud-first approach with AWS CDK and modern data stack (DBT), likely using cloud-native orchestration solutions rather than traditional Airflow.

storage_layer.evidence: Strong emphasis on data warehousing with Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, and Kimball methodology. Focus is on structured, analytics-ready data rather than raw data lakes.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as Manchester, England, United Kingdom with hybrid model requiring minimum 50% office time. UK-only restriction inferred from location specificity.

timezone_focus.evidence: Based in Manchester, UK with offices in London and Bristol. UK timezone (GMT/BST) implied by UK location and no international timezone requirements mentioned.

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid model requires minimum 50% office time in Manchester, and mentions 'For new team members, an initial period will be full-time in the office' - suggests relocation to Manchester area is expected.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No visa sponsorship mentioned in job posting. UK-based role typically would specify visa sponsorship if available, and no mention of work authorization requirements.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of student visa support (OPT/CPT). UK role would typically specify if accepting student visa holders, and no education/visa flexibility mentioned.

citizenship_required.evidence: UK-based role requiring work authorization but no specific citizenship requirement mentioned. Standard for UK roles to require right to work in UK without requiring citizenship.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent position with comprehensive benefits package including pension, healthcare, equity schemes - clearly indicates employee (W2) rather than contractor (1099) arrangement.

benefits_level.evidence: Extensive benefits package including: competitive salary, 25-31 days PTO, pension matching up to 6%, discretionary bonus, equity schemes, private healthcare, dental plan, gym membership, learning programs, professional qualification support - 15+ premium benefits listed.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'talent development programmes' and 'ongoing technical training' but no specific career paths, promotion timelines, or advancement tracks mentioned. Generic development focus without clear structure.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions 'collaborate closely with stakeholders' and 'continuous learning' but no formal mentorship program. Working with experienced team implied but not explicitly stated.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotion opportunities, advancement paths, or career progression. Focus is on current role responsibilities rather than future growth.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring different roles within the company. Role appears focused on data engineering track only.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No specific career tracks mentioned. While talent development programs suggest some growth opportunity, no IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks are outlined.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between must-have skills (14 technical + 8 soft skills) and nice-to-have skills (4 items). Balanced approach with specific technical requirements but flexible on some modern tools.

scope_definition.evidence: Well-defined data engineering role with specific responsibilities around data platform development, ELT pipelines, and data warehousing. Single clear focus area without role confusion.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Skill requirements are appropriate for data engineering role. Technologies mentioned (DBT, Snowflake, Python, AWS) are current and relevant. No unrealistic combinations or excessive years of experience required.
